alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 11 at 8:44PM PST until January 12 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST FRIDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM PST FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet, with dangerous rip currents. For the Beach Hazards Statement, nuisance coastal flooding expected during Friday morning high tide. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 3 AM PST Friday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, Friday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Nuisance coastal flooding expected during Friday morning high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high tide of 6.6 to 6.9 feet is expected at 900 AM Friday morning..
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
